title: Determinant Properties Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of determinant properties and their applications.

questions.question: What is det(A×B) in terms of det(A) and det(B)?
questions.explanation: det(AB) = det(A) × det(B) for square matrices.

questions.question: What happens to det(A) when two rows are interchanged?
questions.explanation: Interchanging two rows changes the sign of the determinant.

questions.question: What is det(Aᵀ)?
questions.explanation: det(Aᵀ) = det(A) - the transpose doesn't change the determinant.

questions.question: What is det(kA) for scalar k and square matrix A?
options: kⁿ × det(A) where n is matrix size
questions.explanation: Scaling a matrix by k scales its determinant by k^n.

questions.question: Which operation does NOT change the determinant?
options: Adding a multiple of one row to another
Multiplying a row by a non-zero scalar
questions.explanation: Adding a multiple of one row to another doesn't change the determinant.
